body_html:
Rebuilt from 7937fb3 and this behavior has changed. I'm not sure that it's quite correct - perhaps it's using the allow_growth option instead of per_process_gpu_memory_fraction?

[0] TITAN X (Pascal) | 60'C, 2 % | 11685 / 12186 MB |
[1] TITAN X (Pascal) | 62'C, 29 % | 12049 / 12189 MB | asher(457M)

is the result of:
session_config.gpu_options.per_process_gpu_memory_fraction = 0.40

Which I would expect to reserve 40% of the available memory from one GPU (exposed via CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES).

body:
Rebuilt from 7937fb34dbd9fd04dc878eefa6ccfe00d1262f2e and this behavior has changed. I'm not sure that it's quite correct - perhaps it's using the allow_growth option instead of per_process_gpu_memory_fraction?

[0] TITAN X (Pascal) | 60'C,   2 % | 11685 / 12186 MB |
[1] TITAN X (Pascal) | 62'C,  29 % | 12049 / 12189 MB | asher(457M)

is the result of:
session_config.gpu_options.per_process_gpu_memory_fraction = 0.40

Which I would expect to reserve 40% of the available memory from one GPU (exposed via CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES).
